result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean L. Grendel Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
----------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Defendant may have contact with his children and their mother as allowed by the Department of Corrections.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Court Reporter Katie Giebel
Denying Defendant's Motion for Stay of Sentence and Bond Pending Appeal

Defendant Sean L. Grendel in court, in custody via video from Dodge Correctional with attorney Brad Lochowicz.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court in session @ 2:15 p.m. Appearances made. Attorney Duquette appears late. The Court has reviewed the motion and supplemental materials. Argument by Attorney Duquette highlighting the lack of harm for the community. 
2:17 p.m. - Question by the Court regarding merits of the appeal. Attorney Duquette cannot speak to the merits of the appeal as appellate attorney has been appointed in this matter.
2:18 p.m. - Argument by ADA Rea
2:19 p.m. - Findings by the Court. Court has considered the required material pursuant to case law. Based upon review of motion and State's response the Court denies the defendant's motion for stay pending appeal. Attorney Duquette to prepare order within one (1) week. 

Court in recess @ 2:21 p.m.

SPD Notice of Ineligibility

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.F.G. (VICTIM) OR S.J.F. OR H.G. OR THEIR RESIDENCE. MUST COMPLY WITH ANY AND ALL DEPARTMENT OF H.S. REQUESTS.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney Julia May. Joshua Grube appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes Filed.
